Effect: Fog deals acid damage.
Full:
A bank of fog billows out from the point the character designates. The fog obscures all sight, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. A creature within 5 feet has one-half concealment (attacks suffer a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker cannot use sight to locate the target). The fog is so thick that any creature attempting to move through it progresses at one-tenth normal speed, and all melee attack and melee damage rolls suffer a –2 penalty. The vapors prevent effective ranged weapon attacks (except for magic rays and the like). A creature or object that falls into the fog is slowed, so that each 10 feet of vapor that the creature or objects passes through reduces falling damage by 1d6.

Each round, starting when the character casts the spell, the fog deals 2d6 points of acid damage to creatures and objects within it.

Only a severe wind (31+ mph) disperses these vapors, and it does so in 1 round.

Effect: +1 attack, +1 on saves against fear, 1d8 temporary hit points.
Full: The subject gains a morale bonus of +1 on attack rolls, a morale bonus of +1 on saving throws against fear effects, and gains 1d8 temporary hit points.

Effect: Subject treads on air as if solid (climb at 45-degree angle).
Full:
The target creature can tread on air as if walking on solid ground. The maximum upward or downward angle possible is 45 degrees, at a rate equal to one-half the creature's normal speed.

A strong wind (21+ mph) can push an air walker along or hold the walker back. At the end of the walker's turn each round, the wind blows the walker 5 feet for each 5 miles per hour of wind speed. The creature can, at the DM's option, be subject to additional penalties in exceptionally strong or turbulent winds.

The character can cast air walk on a specially trained mount so it can be ridden through the air. The character trains a mount to air walk with the Handle Animal skill (air walking counts as an unusual task).

Effect: Wards an area for 2 hours/level.
Full:
Alarm sounds a mental or audible alarm each time a creature of Tiny or larger size enters the area or touches it. A creature who speaks the password (determined by the character at the time of casting) does not set off the alarm. The character decides at the time of casting whether the alarm will be mental or audible.

Mental Alarm: A mental alarm alerts the character (and only the character) so long as the character remains within a mile of the warded area. The character notes a single mental alert that awakens the character from normal sleep but does not otherwise disturb concentration. A silence spell has no effect on a mental alarm.

Audible Alarm: An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell, and anyone within 60 feet of the warded area can hear it clearly. Reduce the distance by 10 feet for each interposing closed door and by 20 feet for each substantial interposing wall. In quiet conditions, the ringing can be heard faintly up to 180 feet away. The ringing lasts for 1 round. Creatures within a silence spell cannot hear the ringing.

Ethereal or astral creatures do not trigger the alarm unless the intruder becomes material while in the warded area.

Effect: As change self, plus more drastic changes.
Full:
The character can alter the character's appearance and form-including clothing and equipment-to appear taller or shorter, thin, fat, or in between. The assumed form must be corporeal. The character's body can undergo a limited physical transmutation, including adding or subtracting one or two limbs, and the character's weight can be changed up to one-half. If the form selected has wings, the character can fly at a speed of 30 feet with poor maneuverability. If the form has gills, the character can breathe underwater.

The character's attack rolls, natural armor bonus, and saves do not change. The spell does not confer special abilities, attack forms, defenses, ability scores, or mannerisms of the chosen form. Once the new form is chosen, it remains for the duration of the spell. If the character is slain, the character automatically returns to the character's normal form.

If the character uses this spell to create a disguise, the character gets a +10 bonus on the character's Disguise check.

Effect: Reveals magical aspects of subject.
Full:
The character discerns spells and magical properties present in a creature or object. One property, spell, or power is revealed each round, from lowest level (or weakest power) to highest (or strongest). For each spell or power, the character makes a caster level check (1d20 + caster level). If the result is equal to or higher than the spell's or power's caster level, the character identifies it. Otherwise, the character fails to identify that spell or power, and the character can check for the next one next round.

Analyze dweomer does not function when used on an artifact.

After the character analyzes one object or creature, the spell ends, even if its duration has not expired yet. The character must make a Fortitude save (DC 21) when the spell ends or be exhausted and unable to do anything but rest for the next 1d8 hours.

Focus: The focus must be worth at least 1,500 gp.

Effect: Gains permanent animal companions.
One animal/two levels doubles in size, HD.
Sends a Tiny animal to a specific place.
One ally/level polymorphs into chosen animal.
Fascinates 2d6 HD of animals.
Creates undead skeletons and zombies.
Objects attack your foes.
Makes a rope move at your command.
10-ft. field hedges out living creatures.
Negates magic within 10 ft.
Object or location affected by spell repels certain creatures.
Keeps animated plants at bay.
Invisible floating eye moves 30 ft./round.
Magically locks a portal or chest.
Inscribes a personal rune (visible or invisible).
Projects you and companions into Astral Plane.
Removes burden of misdeeds from subject.
Learns whether an action will be good or bad.
Animal or tree gains human intellect.
Large hand attacks your foes.
As Bigby's interposing hand, but stronger.
Hand pushes creatures away.
Hand provides cover, pushes, or grapples.
Hand provides 90% cover against one opponent.
Enemies suffer -1 attack, -1 on saves against fear.
Banishes 2 HD/level extraplanar creatures.
Grants +3 natural armor bonus (or higher).
-6 to an ability; -4 on attacks, saves, and checks; or 50% chance of losing each action.
Array of techniques to imprison a creature.
Blades encircling you deal 1d6 damage/level.
Kills, paralyzes, weakens, or dazes nonevil subjects.
Allies gain +1 attack and +1 on saves against fear.
Makes holy water.
Weapon gains +1 bonus.
Makes subject blind or deaf.
You randomly vanish and reappear for 1 round/level.
Attacks miss subject 20% of the time.
Frees subjects from enchantments, alterations, curses, and petrification.
Subject gains 1d4+1 Str for 1 hr./level.
1d4 fire damage/level (max: 5d4).
Directs lightning bolts (1d10/level) during storms.
Time: 10 minutes, plus 1 action per bolt called

Effect: Calms 2d4 +1/level HD of animals, beasts, and magical beasts.
Calms 1d6 subjects/level, negating emotion effects.
Subject gains 1d4+1 Dex for 1 hr./level.
One creature flees for 1d4 rounds.
1d6 damage/level; secondary bolts.
Changes your appearance.
Full:
The character can make his or herself—including clothing, armor, weapons, and equipment—look different. The character can seem 1 foot shorter or taller, thin, fat, or in between. The character cannot change the character's body type. Otherwise, the extent of the apparent change is up to the character.

The spell does not provide the abilities or mannerisms of the chosen form. It does not alter the perceived tactile (touch) or audible (sound) properties of the character or the character's equipment.

If the character uses this spell to create a disguise, the character gets a +10 bonus on the Disguise check.

Note: Creatures get Will saves to recognize the glamer as an illusion if they interact with it.

Effect: Your staff becomes a treant on command.
Damages and staggers lawful creatures.
Makes monster believe it is your ally.
Makes one person your friend.
Full:
This charm makes a humanoid of Medium-size or smaller regard the character as a trusted friend and ally. If the creature is currently being threatened or attacked by the character or the character's allies, however, he receives a +5 bonus on his saving throw.

The spell does not enable the character to control the charmed person as if the person were an automaton, but the subject perceives the character's words and actions in the most favorable way. The character can try to give the subject orders, but the character must win an opposed Charisma check to convince the subject to do anything he or she wouldn’t ordinarily do. (Retries not allowed.) A charmed person never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders. Any act by the character or the character's apparent allies that threatens the charmed person breaks the spell. Note also that the character must speak the person’s language to communicate the character's commands, or else be good at pantomiming.

Effect: Makes one person or animal your friend.
Cold metal damages those who touch it.
1 touch/level deals 1d6 damage and possibly 1 Str damage.
Kills 1d4 HD/level.
Deals 1d8 +1/level damage in all directions.
Hear or see at a distance for 1 min./level.
Full: Clairaudience/clairvoyance enables the character to concentrate upon some locale and hear or see (the character's choice) almost as if the character were there. Distance is not a factor, but the locale must be known—a place familiar to the character or an obvious one. The spell does not allow magically enhanced senses to work through it. If the chosen locale is magically dark, the character sees nothing. If it is naturally pitch black, the character can see in a 10-foot radius around the center of the spell’s effect. Lead sheeting or magical protection blocks the spell, and the character senses that the spell is so blocked. The spell creates an invisible sensor that can be dispelled. The spell functions only on the plane of existence the character is currently occupying.

Effect: +4 AC, +4 resistance, and SR 25 against lawful spells.
Duplicate awakens when original dies.
Kills 3 HD or less; 4-6 HD save or die.
Knocks unconscious, blinds, or stuns 1d6 weak creatures.
Full:
A cone of colors springs forth from the character's hand. The closest 1d6 creatures in the cone are affected. The spell affects each subject according to its HD:

Up to 2: Unconscious for 2d4 rounds, then blinded for 1d4 rounds, and then stunned for 1 round. (Only living creatures are knocked unconscious.)

3 or 4: Blinded for 1d4 rounds, then stunned for 1 round.

5 or more: Stunned for 1 round.

In addition to the obvious effects, a blinded creature suffers a 50% miss chance in combat (all opponents have full concealment), loses any Dexterity bonus to AC, grants a +2 bonus to attackers’ attack rolls (they are effectively invisible), moves at half speed, and suffers a –4 penalty on Search checks and most Strength- and Dexterity-based skills.

A stunned creature can't act and loses any Dexterity bonus to AC. Attackers gain +2 bonuses to attack it.

Sightless creatures are not affected by color spray.

Effect: One subject obeys one-word command for 1 round.
Plants animate and vegetation entangles.
Deity answers one yes-or-no question/level.
Learn about terrain for one mile/level.
Understands all spoken and written languages.
1d6 cold damage/level.
Makes subject behave oddly for 1 round/level.
Fills area with positive energy, making undead weaker.
Ask question of extraplanar entity.
Infects subject with chosen disease.
Sets trigger condition for another spell.
Makes a permanent, heatless torch.
Talk to and control plants & fungi.
Undead don't attack you while under your command.
Raises, lowers, or parts bodies of water.
Changes weather in local area.
Change wind direction and speed.
Feeds three humans (or one horse)/level.
Mummies, spectres, vampires, or ghosts.
Ghouls, shadows, ghasts, wights, or wraiths.
Creates 2 gallons/level of pure water.
Carpet of insects attacks at your command.
Cures 4d8 +1/level damage (max +20).
Cures 1d8 +1/level damage (max +5).
Cures 1 point of damage.
Cures 2d8 +1/level damage (max +10).
Cures 3d8 +1/level damage (max +15).
Makes unholy water.
Prepared object appears in your hand.
Figment torches or other lights.
20-ft. radius of supernatural darkness.
See 60 ft. in total darkness.
60-ft. radius of bright light.
Creature loses next action.
Kills dying creature; you gain 1d8 temporary hp, +2 Str, and +1 level.
Grants immunity to all death spells and effects.
Sees how wounded subjects within 30 ft. are.
Object sheds absolute darkness in 60-ft. radius.
Stops poison from harming subject for 1 hour/level.
1d6 fire damage/level; you can delay blast for 5 rounds.
As sending, plus you can send suggestion.
Fills area with negative energy, making undead stronger.
Kills subject and destroys remains.
Detects species of animals or plants.
Reveals creatures, spells, or objects.
Reveals creatures, spells, or objects.
Reveals creatures, spells, or objects.
Reveals creatures, spells, or objects.
Detects spells and magic items within 60 ft.
Full:
The character can detect magical auras. The amount of information revealed depends on how long the character studies a particular area or subject:

    1st Round: Presence or absence of magical auras.
    2nd Round: Number of different magical auras and the strength of the strongest aura.
    3rd Round: The strength and location of each aura. If the items or creatures bearing the auras are in line of sight, the character can make Spellcraft skill checks to determine the school of magic involved in each. (Make one check per aura; DC 15 + spell level, or 15 + half caster level for a nonspell effect.)

Magical areas, multiple types of magic, or strong local magical emanations may confuse or conceal weaker auras.

Aura Strength: An aura’s magical power and strength depend on a spell’s functioning spell level or an item’s caster level.
Functioning
Spell Level  Item
Caster Level  Aura
Strength
0-level or lingering
aura  Lingering aura  Dim
1st-3rd  1st-5th  Faint
4th-6th  6th-11th  Moderate
7th-9th  12th-20th  Strong
Artifact or deity-level
magic  Beyond mortal caster  Overwhelming

If an aura falls into more than one category, detect magic indicates the stronger of the two.

Length Aura Lingers: How long the aura lingers depends on its original strength:
Aura Strength  Duration
Faint                 1d6 minutes
Moderate          1d6 X 10 minutes
Strong              1d6 hours
Overwhelming  1d6 days

Note: Each round, the character can turn to detect things in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it. Outsiders and elementals are not magical in themselves, but if they are conjured, the conjuration spell registers.

Effect: Detects poison in one creature or small object.
Alerts you of magical eavesdropping.
Reveals hidden doors within 60 ft.

Allows "listening" to surface thoughts.
Reveals undead within 60 ft.
Kills, paralyzes, weakens, or dazes nonlawful subjects.
Teleports you and up to 500 lb.
Bars extradimensional movement.
Reduces size or blights growth of normal plants.
Reveals deliberate falsehoods.
Exact location of creature or object.
Makes one creature or object vanish.
Forces a creature to return to native plane.
+4 bonus against attacks.
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first

Effect: +4 bonus against attacks.
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first

Effect: +4 bonus against attacks.
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first

Effect: +4 bonus against attacks.
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first

Effect: Cancels magical spells and effects.
Attacks miss subject 50%.
Deals 1d6 damage to one undead.
Provides useful advice for specific proposed actions.
You gain attack, damage bonus, +1/three levels.
You gain attack bonus, 18 Str, and 1 hp/level.
Subject animal obeys silent mental commands.
As dominate person, but any creature.
Controls humanoid telepathically.
One subject suffers -2 on attacks, damage, saves, and checks.
Sends message to anyone sleeping.
1d4 +1/level tentacles grapple randomly within 15 ft.
Intense tremor shakes 5-ft./level radius.
Summons 2d4 Large, 1d4 Huge elementals.
Arouses strong emotion in subject.
Gain 1d4+1 Con for 1 hr./level.
Ignores 5 damage/round from one energy type.
Subject gains 2d4 negative levels.
Subject gains 1d4 negative levels.
Object or creature grows +10%/level (max +50%).
Plants entangle everyone in 40-ft.-radius circle.
Captivates all within 100 ft. + 10 ft./level.
Ranged attacks against you suffer 20% miss chance.
Mundane or magical writing vanishes.
You become ethereal for 1 round/level.
Travel to Ethereal Plane with companions.
Doubles your speed.
Deals 6d6 damage when read.
Charm, fear, sicken or sleep one subject.
Transforms raw materials into finished items.
Outlines subjects with light, canceling blur, concealment, etc.
Fools scrying with an illusion.
Subjects within cone flee for 1 round/level.
Objects or creatures fall slowly.
Subject's Int drops to 1.
Shows most direct way to a location.
Notice traps as a rogue does.
Kills one subject.
Acorns and berries become grenades and bombs.
Creatures attacking you take fire damage; you're protected from heat or cold.
Deals 1d6 fire damage/level.
Opened object deals 1d4 +1/level damage.
1d6 damage per level, 20-ft. radius.
Shoots flaming projectiles (extra damage) or fiery bolts (4d6 damage).
Touch attack deals 1d8 +1/two levels damage.
Smites foes with divine fire (1d6/level).
Rolling ball of fire, 2d6 damage, lasts 1 round/level.
Dazzles one creature (-1 attack).
Turns subject creature into statue.
Subject flies at speed of 90.
Fog obscures vision.
Denies area to creatures of another alignment.
Cube of force imprisons all inside.
"Sixth sense" warns of impending danger.
Releases creature suffering imprisonment.
Subject moves normally despite impediments.
Subject becomes insubstantial and can fly slowly.
Connects two planes for travel or summoning.
As lesser geas, plus it affects any creature.
Preserves one corpse.
Figment sounds.
Paralyzes one subject, who exudes stench (-2 penalty) nearby.
Turns insects into giant vermin.
Blinds creatures, outlines invisible creatures.
Full:
A cloud of glittering golden particles covers everyone and everything in the area, blinding creatures and visibly outlining invisible things. Blindness lasts for the duration of the spell. All within the area are covered by the dust, which cannot be removed and continues to sparkle until it fades.

In addition to the obvious effects, a blinded creature suffers a 50% miss chance in combat (all opponents have full concealment), loses any Dexterity bonus to AC, grants a +2 bonus to opponents’ attack rolls (they are effectively invisible), moves at half speed, and suffers a –4 penalty on most Strength- and Dexterity-based skills.

Effect: As minor globe, plus 4th level.
Inscription harms those who pass it.
2d4 berries each cure 1 hp (max 8 hp/24 hours).
Makes 10-ft. square or one object slippery.
Full:
A grease spell covers a solid surface with a layer of slippery grease. Any creature entering the area or caught in it when the spell is cast must make a successful Reflex save or slip, skid, and fall. Those that successfully save can move at half speed across the surface. However, those that remain in the area must each make a new saving throw every round to avoid falling and to be able to move. The DM should adjust saving throws by circumstance.

The spell can also be used to create a greasy coating on an item. Material objects not in use are always affected by this spell, while objects wielded or employed by creatures receive a Reflex saving throw to avoid the effect. If the initial saving throw fails, the creature immediately drops the item. A saving throw must be made each round the creature attempts to pick up or use the greased item.

Effect: As command, but affects one subject/level.
As dispel magic, but +20 on check.
As glyph of warding, but up to 10d8 damage or 6th level spell.
One natural weapon of subject creature gets +1 bonus to attack and damage per three caster levels (max +5)
+1/three levels (max +5).
As lesser planar ally, but up to 24 HD.
As lesser planar binding, but up to 24 HD.
As restoration, plus restores all levels and ability scores
As scrying, but faster and longer.
As shadow conjuration, but up to 4th level and 40% real.
As shadow evocation, but up to 5th level.
Array of magic effects protect area.
Range: Anywhere within the area to be warded

Effect: +1 on one roll, throw, or check.
Blows away or knocks down smaller creatures.
Designates location as holy.
Makes one type of terrain appear like another (field into forest, etc.).
Immobilizes undead for 1 round/level.
Subject loses all but 1d4 hp.
Extra partial action and +4 AC.
Full:
The transmuted creature moves and acts more quickly than normal. This extra speed has several effects.

On its turn, the subject may take an extra partial action, either before or after its regular action.

The subject gains a +4 haste bonus to AC. The subject loses this bonus whenever it would lose a dodge bonus.

The subject can jump one and a half times as far as normal. This increase counts as an enhancement bonus.

Haste dispels and counters slow.

Effect: Cures all damage, diseases, and mental conditions.
As heal on warhorse or other mount.
Cures 1d8 +1/level damage in all directions.
Hot metal damages those who touch it.
Ghostly hand leads subject to you.
Food for one creature/level cures and blesses.
Holds one animal helpless; 1 round/level.
As hold person, but any creature.
Holds one person helpless; 1 round/level.
Holds door shut.
+4 AC, +4 resistance, and SR 25 against evil spells.
Damages and blinds evil creatures.
Weapon becomes +5, does double damage against evil.
Kills, paralyzes, weakens, or dazes nongood subjects.
Deals 1d8 damage/level within 30 ft.
Fascinates 2d4+1 HD/level of creatures.
Fascinates 2d4 HD of creatures.
Hail deals 5d6 damage in cylinder 40 ft. across.
Determines single feature of magic item.
Full:
The spell determines the single most basic function of each magic item, including how to activate that function (if appropriate), and how many charges are left (if any). For a weapon, this will be the “plus” to attack and damage.

If a magic item has multiple different functions that are equally basic, identify determines the lowest-level function. If these functions are also of equal level, the DM decides randomly which is identified.

Arcane Material Components: Worth at least 100 gp value.

Effect: Only intended reader can decipher.
Wall, floor, or ceiling looks real, but anything can pass through.
Transfer spells to subject.
Kills one creature/round.
Entombs subject beneath the earth.
As invisibility, but subject can attack and stay invisible.
Cloud deals 4d6 fire damage/round.
Touch attack, 4d8 +1/level damage (max +20).
Touch, 1d8 +1/level damage (max +5).
Touch attack, 1 point of damage.
Touch attack, 2d8 +1/level damage (max +10).
Touch attack, 3d8 +1/level damage (max +15).
Subject suffers continuous confusion.
Insect horde limits vision, inflicts damage, and weak creatures flee.
Subject is invisible for 10 min./level or until it attacks.
Full:
The creature or object touched vanishes from sight, even from darkvision. If the recipient is a creature carrying gear, the gear vanishes, too. If the character casts the spell on someone else, neither the character nor the character's allies can see the subject, unless the character can normally see invisible things or employ magic to do so.

Items dropped or put down by an invisible creature become visible; items picked up disappear if tucked into the clothing or pouches worn by the creature. Light, however, never becomes invisible, although a source of light can become so (thus, the effect is that of a light with no visible source). Any part of an item that the subject carries but that extends more than 10 feet from it becomes visible, such as a trailing rope.

The subject is not magically silenced, and certain other conditions can render the recipient detectable (such as stepping in a puddle). The spell ends if the subject attacks any creature. For purposes of this spell, an "attack" includes any spell targeting a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. (Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible character’s perceptions.) Actions directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. If the subject attacks directly it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Note that spells such that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.

Effect: Dispels invisibility within 5 ft./level.
Makes everyone within 10 ft. invisible.
Animals can't perceive one subject/level.
Undead can't perceive one subject/level.
Your body becomes living iron.
Magical wood is strong as steel.
Subject gets +30 on Jump checks.
Doubles normal weapon's threat range.

You discern north.

Creates sturdy cottage.

Makes item seem trapped.
Learn tales about a person, place, or thing.

Exchange services with an 8 HD outsider.
Traps outsider until it performs a task.

Subject moves up and down at your direction.
Range: Personal or Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)

Effect: Object shines like a torch.
Electricity deals 1d6 damage/level.
Alters reality-within spell limits.
Oak becomes treant guardian.
Indicates direction to familiar creature.
Senses direction toward object (specific or type).
Ranged touch attack; 2d4 damage for 1 round + 1 round/three levels.
Dispels magic, disenchants magic items.
Phantom dog can guard, attack.
Duration: 1 hour/caster level or until discharged, then 1 round/caster level

Effect: Recalls spell of 5th level or less. (Wizard only.)
Door leads to extradimensional mansion.
Floating magic blade strikes opponents.
Gives subject +4 armor bonus.
Full: An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of mage armor, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC. Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance, or speed reduction. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal armor.

Effect: 5-pound telekinesis.
As protection spells, but 10-ft. radius and 10 min./level.
As protection spells, but 10-ft. radius and 10 min./level.
As protection spells, but 10-ft. radius and 10 min./level.
As protection spells, but 10-ft. radius and 10 min./level.
One natural weapon of subject creature gets +1 bonus to attack and damage.
Enables possession of another creature.
Duration: 1 hour/level or until the character returns to the character's body

Effect: 1d4+1 damage; +1 missile/two levels above 1st (max +5).
Speaks once when triggered.
Three stones gain +1 attack, deal 1d6+1 damage.
Armor or shield gains +1 enhancement/three levels.
Weapon gains +1 bonus.
As minor creation, plus stone and metal.
As silent image, plus sound, smell and thermal effects.
Repairs an object.
Designates action that will trigger curse on subject.
As charm monster, but all within 30 ft.
As haste, affects one/level subjects.
As heal, but with several subjects.
As invisibility, but affects all in range.
As suggestion, plus one/level subjects.
Traps subject in extradimensional maze.
You and your gear merge with stone.
Makes minor repairs on an object.
Whispered conversation at distance.
Deals 24d6 fire damage, plus bursts.
Subject is immune to mental/emotional magic and scrying.
Subjects in fog get -10 Wis, Will checks.
Creates one cloth or wood object.
Stops 1st- through 3rd-level spell effects.
As silent image, plus some sound.
Requests a deity's intercession.
As hallucinatory terrain, plus structures.
Creates decoy duplicates of you (1d4 +1/three levels, max 8).
Full:
Several illusory duplicates of the character pop into being, making it difficult for enemies to know which target to attack. The figments stay near the character and disappear when struck.

Mirror image creates 1d4 images plus one image per three caster levels (maximum eight images). These figments separate from the character and remain in a cluster, each within 5 feet of at least one other figment or the character. The character can move into and through a mirror image. When the character and the mirror image separate, observers can't use vision or hearing to tell which one is the character and which the image. The figments may also move through each other. The figments mimic the character's actions.

Enemies attempting to attack the character or cast spells at the character must select from among indistinguishable targets. Generally, roll randomly to see whether the selected target is real or a figment. Any successful attack roll against a figment destroys it. A figment's AC is 10 + size modifier + Dexterity modifier. Figments seem to react normally to area spells.

While moving, the character can merge with and split off from figments so that enemies who have learned which image is real are again confounded.

An attacker must be able to see the images to be fooled. If the character is invisible or an attacker shuts her eyes, the spell has no effect, though being unable to see carries the same penalties as being blinded: In addition to the obvious effects, a blinded creature suffers a 50% miss chance in combat (all opponents have full concealment), loses any Dexterity bonus to AC, grants a +2 bonus to attackers' attack rolls (they are effectively invisible), moves at half speed, and suffers a –4 penalty on most Strength- and Dexterity-based skills.

Effect: Misleads divinations for one creature or object.
Turns you invisible and creates illusory double.
Changes 5 minutes of subject's memories.
Summons riding horse for 2 hr./level.
Digs trenches and build hills.
Grants object false magic aura.
Masks magic item's aura.
Subject resists level and ability drains.
Detoxifies venom in or on subject.
Sends vision dealing 1d10 damage, fatigue.
Hides subject from divination, scrying.
Freezes water or deals cold damage.
Forces subject to dance.
Force globe protects but traps one subject.
As Otiluke's resilient sphere, but you move sphere telekinetically.
Masks object against divination.
Fog surrounds you.

Effect: Creates partially real double of a creature.
Touch attack kills subject.
Put 2d4 HD of creatures into comatose slumber.
Full:
A sleep spell causes a comatose slumber to come upon one or more creatures. Roll 2d4 to determine how many total HD of creatures can be affected. Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first. Among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spell’s point of origin are affected first. No creature with 5 or more HD is affected, and HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.

Creatures with fewer HD are affected first.

Sleeping creatures are helpless. Slapping or wounding awakens affected creatures, but normal noise does not. Awakening a creature is a standard action.

Sleep does not target unconscious creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.

Compels subject to follow stated course of action.
Full:
The character influences the actions of the enchanted creature by suggesting a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two). The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the activity sound reasonable.

The suggested course of activity can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what he was asked to do. The character can instead specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. If the condition is not met before the spell expires, the activity is not performed.

A very reasonable suggestion causes the save to be made with a penalty (such as –1, –2, etc.) at the discretion of the DM.

Effect: Calls outsider to fight for you.
Full:
This spell summons an outsider (extraplanar creature). It appears where the character designates and acts immediately, on the character’s turn. It attacks the character’s opponents to the best of its ability. If the character can communicate with the outsider, the character can direct it not to attack, to attack particular enemies, or to perform other actions. Summoned creatures act normally on the last round of the spell and disappear at the end of their turn.

The spell conjures one of the creatures from the 1st-level list on the Summon Monster table below. The character chooses which creature to summon, and can change that choice each time the spell is cast.
1st-level
Celestial dog (animal)  LG
Celestial badger (animal)  CG
Fiendish dire rat  LE
Fiendish hawk (animal)  CE

When the character uses a summoning spell to summon an air, chaotic, earth, evil, fire, good, lawful, or water creature, it is a spell of that type.

Effect: Calls creature to fight.
Calls creature to fight.
Calls creature to fight.
Summons swarm of small crawling or flying creatures.
Full:
A swarm of little creatures carpets the effect’s area, viciously attacking all other creatures there. (Roll on the table below to see what sort of creature is summoned.) A creature in the swarm who takes no actions other than fighting off the swarming creatures takes 1 point of damage on its turn. A creature in the swarm who takes any other action, including leaving the swarm, takes 1d4 points of damage +1 point per three caster levels. Spellcasting or concentrating on spells within the swarm is impossible.
1d20  Swarm Type*
1-8  Rats (animals)
9-14  Bats (animals)
15-16  Spiders (vermin, poisonous)
17-18  Centipedes (vermin, poisonous)
19-20  Flying beetles (vermin)
* The creature types (in parentheses) indicate what sorts of spells and effects might aid a subject against the swarm.

A swarm of poisonous creatures deals no damage to creatures who are immune to poison, though it still prevents spellcasting and concentration. The creatures’ attacks are nonmagical. Damage reduction, being incorporeal, and other special abilities also make a creature immune to damage from the swarm.

The swarm cannot be fought effectively with weapons, but fire and damaging area effects can force it to disperse. The swarm disperses when it has taken a total of 2 hit points of damage per caster level from these attacks. Certain area or effect spells disperse a swarm immediately if appropriate to the swarm summoned.

The swarm is stationary once summoned. A druid caster, however, can (as a move-equivalent action) direct the swarm to move up to 30 feet per round (or 90 feet per round if the druid has summoned bats or beetles).

Kills one creature/level.
Deals 2d4 fire damage out to 10 ft. and 1d4 out to 20 ft. Passing through wall deals 2d6 +1/level.
Wall is immune to damage.
Ice plane creates wall with 15 hp +1/level, or hemisphere can trap creatures inside.
30 hp/four levels; can topple onto foes.
20 hp/four levels; can be shaped.
Thorns damage anyone who tries to pass.
Bends wood (shaft, handle, door, plank).
Subjects can breathe underwater.
Subject treads on water as if solid.
Fills 10-ft. cube/level with sticky spider webs.
Full:
Web creates a many-layered mass of strong, sticky strands. These strands trap those caught in them. The strands are similar to spider webs but far larger and tougher. These masses must be anchored to two or more solid and diametrically opposed points or else the web collapses upon itself and disappears. Creatures caught within a web or simply touching its strands become entangled among the gluey fibers.

An entangled creature suffers a –2 penalty to attack rolls, suffers a –4 penalty to effective Dexterity, and can’t move. An entangled character who attempts to cast a spell must make a Concentration check (DC 15) or lose the spell.

Anyone in the effect's area when the spell is cast must make a Reflex save. If this save succeeds, the creature is not stuck in the webs and is free to act, though moving may be a problem (see below). If the save fails, the creature is stuck. A stuck creature can break loose by spending 1 round and succeeding at a Strength check (DC 20) or an Escape Artist check (DC 25). Once loose (either by making the initial Reflex save or a later Strength check or Escape Artist check), a creature may progress through the web very slowly. Each round devoted to moving allows the creature to make a new Strength check or Escape Artist check. The creature moves 5 feet for each full 5 points by which the check result exceeds 10.

The web provides one-quarter cover for every 5 feet of the substance between the character and an opponent—one-half cover for 10 feet of web, three-quarters for 15 feet, and total cover for 20 feet or more.

The strands of a web spell are flammable. Any fire can set them alight and burn away 5 square feet in 1 round. All creatures within flaming webs take 2d4 points of damage from the flames.
